review: Good atmosphere, good food. It is by far the slowest service Red Robin consistently. I live in Wilsonville and dread it when my kids want to eat here. Tonight 15 minutes for a server just to come to the table to take a drink order. Ordered 15 minutes ago and still waiting. Maybe by the time this post we may actually see our server again. Doubtful....argh! At least offer some fries while we wait!

My boyfriend and I just got out of this restaurant and experienced a really nice waitress up until she thought she wasn't getting a tip. We paid in cash with the bill being $26.16 and gave her $27. She came back to the table and put the change on the table and we said thanks and she said "yep" and walked away with the meanest look on her face and didn't look at either of us. She didn't even tell us have a good day or thanks for coming in.  I like to wait till we're just about to leave to place a tip on the table because it's moments like these that make me not want to tip. I ended up giving her a 18% and I was going to give 20% until she was rude because she thought we weren't tipping her.  I am a waitress and my boyfriend is a waiter so we could completely tell that this is why she was being rude.

Ordered avocado salad. It was good. My gf ordered the same thing only to find a very long hair buried in the salad. Waitress was sympathetic and made it right. The floor was slippery throughout the restaurant. Reminded me of the greasy floor in the kitchen when I worked at McDonald's in the 80's. Even when sitting, putting the weight of my foot on the floor caused it to slide forward, despite wearing non slip shoes. I used tablet at the table to pay the bill. When I signed with my finger I noticed there was grease and food smeared on the screen.

I don't know if it's that this place has great service, or if it is that other places in Wilsonville suck. And I mean it, a Wilsonville has the worst customer service second to one other city...but that's another time/story/review. Red Robin, the food is roughly the same as other Red Robin's. The difference with this one!!!! When all you want to do is have good service and have dinner. And maybe a beer.  Realistically that is all.

Enjoyed our night before Thanksgiving dinner here and had the arctic cod fish sandwich with an EGG on it, yes, I said EGG! It is delicious. The french fries always seem so minuscule on the plate when you get your order, but they are bottomless and the burgers are so big and juicy, it makes sense.  The husband tried a new pepper burger and my brother in law had the Whiskey beef burger. He ordered it without mayo and it came with mayo. He scraped it off and sad the burger was cooked perfectly. Our server, Nick, was fantastic and he ended up turning me on to a new beer when I asked if they had any good red ales. It was MacNJacks African ALe. DELICIOUS!!! I am now on the hunt for this Redmond, Or made beer.  We were seated quickly when we walked in because we were all over 21 and had no children, so we were seated quickly within the 21 and older section. Can I just say, I love this section and concept. Not all of us have or want children and it is nice to be able to go somewhere, have a few beers, let your hair down and not have to worry about offending some parent with their kids sitting at the bar because you dropped an "F" bomb. Thanks Red Robin. See you again soon!

I love Red Robin. I'd give any Red Robin 5 stars honestly. Always happy to go! This is the only chain restaurant I'm happy to go to because I know exactly what to expect and there's a level of comfort in that. My only gripe is the employees appearance here is not as regulated as some of the other restaurants around. I saw torn up red vans from a male employee.. and the waitress had very long necklaces on that was close to touching our food. Other than that, this ones not my favorite but I'll still give it 4 stars.

Stopped in on a Friday night for dinner as we were passing through town on the interstate.  I wasn't really feeling all that great, but needed to eat something  (as did everyone else in the car ) before we headed on up the freeway.  The server messed up and put lemon in my sods instead of the requested lime, but was very quick to rectify the situation  (yes, lemon in my drink is a situation ).  I ordered the chicken strips and fries, husband had a chicken sandwich burger thing and stepson had a whisky river bbq burger.  I don't think anyone had any complaints about their orders, but it wasn't anything oooh aaah spectacular, I mean it was chicken strips after all. I really like the self pay at your table that RR has adopted.  Makes it so much easier when you are trying to keep a schedule if you don't have to wait for the server to bring you the check.

Yet another variation of the pub mac and cheese, but it was still pretty good (work on your consistency Red Robin please). We had the nachos as an appetizer and let's just say that they didn't last very long (grubbin!), and the cherry limeade hit the spot as well.  Lizzie was our server and she did a great job, with a friendly attitude. Our drinks didn't make it to empty before we had a replacement on the table. Thumbs up for Lizzie :)

Meh, is the best way to describe it.  We ordered drinks and a couple appetizers, then ordered our food. I ordered the DGB burger which looked delicious.  We received our food just a few short minutes later, then noticed a long and thick strand of hair in my burger. The waiter came back asked if we needed anything as I had been looking over at him trying to get his attention, I showed him the hair that was still attached to the veggies. He apologized and took it right away.  He came back a couple minutes later with more fries and said the manager would be remaking it. Instead of asking if I'd prefer something else or at least take something off our bill.  Got my burger, was expecting more and that goes for all the food. Paying over $60 for a meal that was meh is a bit depressing. My daughters meal looked like it was literally just thrown on the plate.  I probably won't be back.

Awful service orderd came for everyone but my son.. feed him my sweet potato fries took 15 min to get his pizza and me regular fries wife paid the bill cause I would have refused to give a tip. Wont be back.

I hate coming to this RR. It has the worst service. Wasn't my choice to come here. Just took 15 min for pretzel bites. 10 min for a ice tea. What a joke they need to just close this location. There are better RR close by. Don't know what they do just sit around. It's a joke hopefully the management will see this and send an auditor in here.

I haven't been here for a few years, so when my best friend expressed he wanted to go there for our next lunch date, I said okay.  I walk in and the hostess is accommodating and she's friendly and leads me to my table. I sit and I wait for maybe 2-3 minutes before my waitress comes and asks if I'm waiting for someone. I say yes, and instead of asking me if I would like a drink meanwhile, she starts walking away. I tell her I would like to order a root beer meanwhile I'm waiting for my friend and she says okay and walks off. Comes back 5 minutes later with the drink and walks off again.  My friend arrives 15 minutes later and a different waitress comes up and asks if we're ready to order as we were about to send off our order using the machine. We ask her to give us a few minutes to decide and so she leaves. 20 minutes later, a different waitress comes by and asks if we're ready, so say yes and we give her our order. I order my bacon cheeseburger with no tomatoes and with cheddar cheese, and instead of the regular bottomless fries, if I can get the herb fries instead. She says yes and my friend orders his with an extra serving of fries. She takes our order and leaves. 10 minutes more pass and our onion rings come out. We're sitting and chatting and playing on the machine while we wait, and another different waitress ( this is 4 now) comes and delivers our food. The burgers were correct but they gave me regular fries. They neglected to give my friend his extra serving of fries. The fries they DO give us however, are half assed barely filled containers. We shrug it off because it's bottomless anyways. So we didn't worry.  We're chit chatting, eating and finishing up drinks, and one waitress comes by to collect my friend's empty glasses, and leaves mine. She clearly saw it because it was RIGHT next to my friends. She asks if he found everything okay, totally ignoring me. At this point, I'm either thinking she's being rude to me for no reason, or it's probably because she doesn't think being friendly to me is worth anything. I resolve to give her a minimum tip.  We continue talking and playing games, and not once has any of those waitresses asked if we'd like a refill on our fries. Not even once. They don't come back after collecting the cups, so we decide to order our dessert using the machine. They deliver it, collects our plates and say nothing. We don't see them afterwards. Drinks are empty, no offers on refills for our bottomless fries, and they forgotten about us.  Overall, their customer service needs to be improved. Food was okay. Attitudes need adjusting.

I've had mixed success here. A lot depends on the waiters/waitresses I guess. I go here about once a month or so, and most of the time staff is courteous and helpful and the food is good. The last two times we went there it seemed, we had some attitude from the waiters. This can make or break a dining experience in my opinion. My wife has an allergic reaction to gluten, for her its not a preference as much as a need. We ordered gluten free for her, and they made a regular hamburger with regular fries. We asked him to correct her order, and he insisted it should be fine to keep the innards and just throw it on a new Gluten free bun. It was still contaminated, and looked really messy when he finished. He was kind of grumpy about it so we just ate anyway. Furthermore, the fries were not gluten free, and he didn't want to fix that either (while all fries are potato, gluten free fries are made in a separate part of the kitchen to avoid contamination). The next time we went, we came for desert, and ordered a giant mud pie to split. The waiter gave us grief for not ordering a full meal. He tried to pass it off as a joke when we looked a bit upset, but mentioned it later when it came time to pay (sarcastically saying, "who's going to splurge for the bill?"). I've never felt so humiliated in a restaurant! We weren't trying to be cheap, we just didn't need more food.  I don't want to give it 2 stars based on a couple of grumpy waiter's, but I'm hoping the next time we go will be better.

My wife and I stopped by around 3:30 on a Friday afternoon. We assumed based on the time of day we would be able to get in and out fairly quick. As we walked thru the front door, we were immediately taken to a table where we sat un acknowledged for at least 20 minutes. A waiter walked past us twice, but didn't appear to have any interest in taking care of us. We decided we had wasted enough time and headed for the door. As we walked past the host, I told him he should try to seat customers at a table that actually has an assigned server. His reply was "okay". I can't believe this location is able to stay in business!
When you order to go check your fries. They give you like seven... maybe 8 fries... lol.

Hi guy's, omg I love this resturant. It was my birthday and got my free takeout. It was the fish sandwich which was to die for. They were so courteous and polite they even gave me ranch on the side (which was one of best ranches had). It's a lively upbeat place colorful.

We decided to give this location another chance because the first visit was less than stellar. Staff is friendly enough. The Marco Pollo was very good. Hamburger was dry. Ordered sweet potato fries and they were cold. Returned for regular fries. Not super excited about server rushing is through the checkout process but whatever. We won't be back to this location.  I wish it would have been better.

After many satisfying visits to this Red Robin location, I had an experience that seems to closely match other recent visits by other yelpers. I still hold high regard for the chain in general, but today's execution really left a lot to be desired. If this had been my only visit, I would have put it at two stars -- but I'm not ready to write them off yet. My wife, son, and daughter accompanied me on this visit, and we requested one children's menu at the hostess station. After getting situated, my daughter informed me she had a menu, but no crayons or paper place-mat (aka entertainment) -- no big deal, but it took a little while to make it to the table. Drink and main dish ordering was uneventful. And then we waited... and waited... and waited. Our server finally stopped by, saw we had no food yet, and said he would go check on it... When our food finally arrived, everyone's dishes were fine except for mine -- I had ordered a Red's Big Tavern, Fiery Ghost Style, with a side salad; and they brought out what looked like a kid's cheeseburger. The waiter left the salad and took the burger back -- at which point I realized that our table had no silverware, which meant I had no way to eat the salad. The waiter came back and said they were firing a new burger for me, and that he would bring silverware -- he claimed the burger just had the wrong cheese on it, but I know it was a complete screw up somewhere along the line. Finally my burger came out, and our server disappeared. My son downed all of his fries and wanted more, but the server was nowhere to be found. I drained my iced tea, thanks to some especially spicy jalapenos; but no waiter around to refill. My wife's water ran dry. The long wait made for an even longer experience because we then had to wait for everything to be refilled. The food was good, overall; but all of the other miscues really detracted from the experience. Any one mistake as a stand-alone would not be a big deal, but all of them together in one visit made for a very amateurish execution. We will be back, but I really hope they figure out how to step up their game between now and then.

The last few visits to this Red Robin has been disappointing. Gourmet burgers HA. Tastes like a normal burger with some extra stuff thrown on it. The staff are fake in their wishing you a good day and so slow. Both recent visits we had to have another waitress track down our waitress and then it takes them just as long get your change. We have watched our waitress sit down to eat and chat when she was supposed to be waiting on people and then tell us she forgot what she was doing. Customer service is their job 99% but still can't get it right.

Hit or miss here.  Was super pleased with a recent visit.  The food was amazing with a BBQ wrap & a bruschetta turkey burger me and my wife split.  Came back a week or two later to  get the same thing and the turkey burger was horrible/uneatable.  I took a bite, my wife took a bite and we set it down. Told the waiter about it and he asked if we could see anything different and I said "no".  Apparently since I didn't know exactly what was wrong with the burger we were not deserving of an alternative to make up for it.  So, since I wasn't full I just ate some more frys and still left feeling hungry and unsatisfied... I understand in the service industry sometimes people try to get away with things or get freebies.  Problem for us was, pretty much the whole turkey burger was uneaten (minus 2 bites). So he (the waiter) could clearly see we weren't going to eat the burger, so it wasn't like we were trying to get some extra food or a handout.   So he left us paying for an $11 burger that we didn't even eat.  There was no offer of something else or even a do-over.  He didn't bother to try an get it taken off our bill, just left us to pay for an uneaten burger and sent us on our way.  I brought it up to him hoping he might try to help us out in some form or another, but he basically shrugged it off and moved on.   Truly some of the worst service I've ever received.  Me and my wife both decided we were never going back.  It's not a cheap place and I'm not a fan of paying exuberant prices if I'm left to pay the tab when given garbage food.  And it wasn't so much the food as much as the lack of help when it was clear the food was not to our liking.  Just very poor service if anything goes wrong, so just a heads up.

After dropping our dogs off at Critter Cabana, the 3 of us came here for lunch while the rest of the family opted for a fast food joint in Canby. We were eating late, so Kevin and I decided to share a burger while the daughter had a chicken sandwich. We all appreciated that we could substitute other things like melon or kettle chips for the bottomless fries.  Red Robin does not make great burgers. They are pre-formed and are not really able to be cooked to anything less than medium. They do make some mean onion rings and service was efficient with our beverages being refilled regularly.  We would come back to this location and the husband is definitely intrigued by the idea of a bottomless root beer float so who knows if it will be during this vacation or not. I would veto going to a RR back home (due to better restaurants around). but it was a sufficient late lunch in the area.
Everything you expect from red robin, just take out this time, they gave extra fries which was nice, not all locations do that with pick up.

My mother I have been to this Red Robin many many times the food and service are always excellent. we went in today on Mother's Day to have their delicious fish and chips a must have. this particular dish is always always perfect delicious and the portions are very satisfying. Nick was our server and he was very very sweet polite and prompt. the icing on the cake is when Tracey one of the managers gave my mother a complimentary sundae with hot fudge and caramel for Mother's Day. We love this place and will go back again and again

This is just an update that the owner reached out to me after I left the review to apologize for the trouble I went through. She also gave me a gift card that covered the amount I had spent there which was nice. Since I am back in California I used it at my local Red Robin. I appreciated the fact she contacted me and hopefully the rude/incompetent employee was addressed.

We are fairly regular red robin diners. This was our first time at the wilsonville one.  Although convenient because it's right off I5, the food quality here is totally subpar. The salad I ordered was a plate full of pink lettuce (and missing grilled pineapple-- I ordered a bonsai salad), the kids meatballs were shriveled and dried up, and the fries were soggy.  So sad.
Worst service I've had I'm my life... waited 30 minutes to order drinks and another 45 for food and there were less than 10 people on the whole restaurant

This is good food and good service.  The inside of the place is well decorated.  The steak fries are in my opinion the best you can get anywhere and at RR you can have as many as you want. The food is served quickly and it's what I ordered.  I am not thrilled about paying $10 for a hamburger and fries - even as good as they are here.  It makes me wonder if 4 stars is appropriate - I wish I could rate it 3 1/2 stars but I think I may have a bit of an old-school idea when it comes to 'fair pricing' so I went with 4.

Stopped here for a bite to eat on the way home after a road trip only because I had a $25 gift card. The poor service started quickly and was constant throughout. Wanted to sit in the lounge section so I can keep my eye on my vehicle so the lady at the front said only for 21 and over. I don't look 15 and neither does my lady but we weren't planning on getting drinks so no big deal we went and sat. Immediately were interrogated for our ID's. My lady left hers in the vehicle, so she had to go out and grabs hers and I show the bartender mine. He walks away. Before my lady returned he came order to get my drink order. I said I'd wait for her to return first. Then we ordered onion ring appetizers which were super greasy and there were no napkins at the table. I walked to the bus station and grabbed some and no one made an effort to apologize or take notice. Then we ordered the food. It arrived quickly but we had no silver ware or napkins and had to ask for them. I ordered my burger without tomatoes and a side of bbq sauce. I didn't receive my side and the burger had tomatoes on it. Okay food, but don't come here expecting good service. Likely will never head to a red robins again, and if I do it'll be because I was given a gift card, or I just may sell it to someone for half the value.

I have had sort of hit-or-miss luck here but have found several things I like now - I have to be cautious, their burgers are too greasy for me, but some of the chicken dishes and such are okay for me - and some of those are yummy! It's not my favorite place but I can eat here happily enough. And now that I've been more times...the staff are excellent about being there when you need them and yet not hovering, and they're all very polite/friendly, including to our two-year-old.

This review is for the Red Robin in Wilsonville Oregon we've been going to this Red Robin for a long time and I gotta say that the food is always excellent service is always excellent the manager always steps by the restrooms clean the lobby is clean kind of a noisy place but you know what I just goes to show that people love going there we go there at least 3 times a month 4 times and we're celebrating a birthday or a party I recommend this place to everybody thank you

So far not impressed. The new decor is uncomfortable and we waited an hour and 15 min to be seated. Yes it's Friday night and we have 3 kids and 3 adults but there was dirty tables just sitting there with no effort to clean off. Our table had bits of lettuce and sauce left over from previous diners. The food came out and the waitress told us they ran out of sauce for our DGB burgers but I told them I was fine without it. The booth we sat in was very uncomfortable and every time one person got up the seat moved- it was like we were on a blowup mattress. Weird. Overall I probably won't go back- it's just a burger place and WOW burger is just as good.

I ordered the clucks and shrimp after going back-and-forth in my mind between that and the guacamole bacon burger. The chicken was pretty dry and did not have much flavor and the batter that the shrimp was Friday and was really doughy. I know now that when I go to red Robin I should always go for the burger. My boyfriend Steve ordered the gourmet cheeseburger. He said it was really good other than they could have sliced red onions dinner he ended up taking them off of his burger they were so thick. We love red Robin and will be back, but I will not order that meal again. Our server Tyler was very good.

We like the food and were regular customers.  We had a terrible experience and complained to both the manager and the corporate office.  Red Robin sent us a $10 gift card to make up for a $60 cold dinner that took an hour to make.  There are other great hamburger restaurants in Wilsonville.  Red Robin will not get my business.  The service is awful and the management does not care.   There is no option for negative stars, so I have to give them one star.

I wish I could leave feedback without any stars.  My kids (older 13 and 19) my mom and mother in law went here last night (5/19/15).  We got there about 7:25pm.  Restaurant had multiple empty tables, we put our name in and were told it would be a 25 minute wait.  Um okay.. anyone familiar with this Red Robin when I say the parking lot had 20+ open spots know the restaurant wasn't busy.  After 30 minutes the manager came to us and asked us our name, we told him and he said something to the effect they're bussing a table for you.  Finally seated.  Have been at restaurant just under 35 minutes.  Waitress came to our table after 5 or so minutes, took our drink order, I asked if they had Fat Tire or Drop Top on tap, she said Drop top, ordered Drop Top, 2 diet cokes, 1 glass water and coffee with cream.  Not quite 15 minutes later she is back with drinks, no coffee - is making it, three sodas and a glass of water.  She  sets the 3 sodas down and we ask what they are, she points, Dr. Pepper and those two are diet.  Um we didn't order Dr.Pepper, yes we're sure.  Oh, she wants to know what I ordered (are you kidding me?!), uh Drop Top.  She takes our dinner order.  5 minutes later the bartender is standing next to me saying excuse me, i have a glass of (cant remember what it was because it wasnt Drop Top) I let her know I ordered a beer buy not the kind she has/brought.  She asks me if I'm sure, I said I ordered Drop Top, bartender informs me they don't have drop top on tap.  So I ask about Fat Tire, she tells me she can get me one but in the bottle - nevermind, I'll have iced tea.  A few minutes later our waitress appears with the iced tea telling me she heard I changed my mind?!  After  45 minutes, no food one cup of cold coffee we left money for the drinks and left.  We have had Bonnie wait on us several times at this Red Robin, never has she amazed us with her service, she's a mediocre at best waitress...well until last night.  We watched as one man in her section got up and went around to the various empty table around us looking for a bottle of ketchup that actually had ketchup in it.   The service was horrible.  We collectively will never return to the Wilsonville Red Robin...after they remodeled or updated this location and their service changed dramatically - and not for the better.  We prefered  this location over Sherwood because it was acoustically it's easier to have a conversation.  Looks like Red Robin is no longer an option.  We had decided last night on Red Robin because my late husband enjoyed the Drop Top tap beer and steak fries.  He passed away two years ago this past April, yesterday, 5/19 would have been his 46th Birthday.  Thank you Bonnie and the entire inept crew at the Wilsonville Red Robin for making the evening memorable, you all were truly awful.

Banzai!  I'm all about the Banzai Burger and Freckled Lemonade.  When we can't decide where to go on a Friday night with the family, this is usually high on the list.  A place where everyone can find something on the menu.   This is a well run location and I have a friend whose daughter works here.  Interesting to hear how specifically they train their staff.  It sounds almost like military drills.  I do tend to prefer the one-on-one interaction at restaurants, but they have a pretty effective team system here. This is also a typical stop to celebrate birthdays.  The kids love the attention and special ice cream sundae.  Although I should note that Son #1 usually cleans his plate pretty quickly and needs more food.  Guess he's at that scary age where I might need to start ordering off the adult menu.  Although we just discovered that they will give you an extra portion of the kids meal entree if they clean their plate.  Yeah! This location has about six arcade games and at least one of them is guaranteed to eat your quarters.  But it is nice having some distractions while we are waiting for our food to arrive.  There is also an outdoor patio which is nice on hot summer nights. Sometimes they have the mascot walk around and greet the kids and they usually hand out balloons. I've had a number of their soups, salads and wraps, but usually just splurge on the Banzai.
As good as any Red Robin I've been to! Never have to wait long to be seated, the food is always good, & the staff & servers are very nice.

Anyone who is everyone loves the dirty bird. Our server (Nathalie) was amazing! The gal had two big parties on top of three other tables (including ours). She did a great job, and was completely on top of tending to each table. Our food was mediocre, but the service was prompt.. The best we have had at this location in awhile. Two thumbs up Wilsonville RR!

If you like burgers, then of course you will like Red Robin.  Many types of burgers and fries, good salads, very attentive wait staff, and a very pleasing and comfortable atmosphere.  I've had mostly very good experiences there.  The drawback of course is that at the end of the day you are paying a pretty outrageous price for a burger and fries.

My family goes to Red Robin all the time because they have such a kid friendly menu, and loud toddlers talking don't disturb others.  However, every single time we go to this particular location, we vow never to return.  This time, we'll probably stick with our vow.   The reason for our vow never to return is the absolutely terrible service we get EVERY SINGLE TIME.  Most recently, our table never seemed to have a server (the manager finally came and took our order after we sat there for half an hour).  The excuse given this time was that a large party was taking up a lot of the servers, but that's really no excuse at all. In the past, we've also had to wait unreasonably long times to have our order taken, to get our food, and to get our check to pay.  Once we had to stand at our table for more than 5 minutes waiting for the host to come with the highchair, and eventually we just went and hunted one down ourselves.  Just atrocious.  If you want the yummy food that Red Robin serves, definitely take the time to drive to one of their alternate locations.  We've consistently had good service at the Washington Square location.
Good food. Lisa in the bar is an exceptional server. Pleasant, attentive, and great at her job.

The BLTA sandwich and crispy chicken salad are my favorite! And their fries, add some spice and ketchup and they're so good.  They also have a good Oreo milkshake. They give you the extra for the shake, so it's enough for two to share in my opinion. They have bottomless fries as well, and you can ask them to bring them out before your food. Eat away!

This is by far the worst service experience I've ever had in my adult life. Seriously, skip it and take a different exit. The waitress got the order wrong-not surprising considering she was distracted and smacking her gum the entire time. Our food was delivered by a man who, unbeknownst to us at the time, was the manager. The order was so severely messed up that we actually asked him to come back so that he could write down the details. He ignored this, and later delivered the food a second time and it was still incorrect. We also ordered a root beer for our son and they delivered a milkshake instead.  To top it off, we waited 15 minutes for a drink order (after all of the above had already occurred). When our waitress finally delivered the drinks, she spilled her tray and the drinks landed squarely in our laps, with a shattered glass on the floor next to us. She told us and the person next to us to "not move", then walked away. She never returned and after several minutes we stepped over the broken glass and left.

Ordered food to go from home.  They said 20 min. Ok no problem.  Well it's been 40 min and still no food.  I am not happy.  Bartender Martin didn't give a crap either.  At least he could say I am sorry we are running behind but he just keeps serving drinks and checks 1 time in the kitchen to see where my food is at.  Both Tualatin and Wilsonville Red Robins suck lately.  Where is the management??? Finally food in 45min.

Horrible slow service...ordered the A1 burger and it came as a molten greasy mess.  Told the server I did not want it and she told me she would send the manager over (I didn't ask for him).  Manager comes over and says "what do you want". I told him I didn't ask for him and I just sent a burger back that I wouldn't eat.   Comped the burger, which is expected as I only ate two bites from it.  Rude crappy service and horrible food.  Won't ever go back to a RR again.

One star is kinda pushing it. My wife and I received two burnt hamburgers and I asked for the special dipping sauce, they brought me the peppercorn sauce that goes on the burger (they don't even know what their sauces are). It was kind of comical. It does always surprise me when a manager comes over after you haven't eaten and asks if the can re-cook your food. It is pretty clear that any cook knows when they are sending out garbage, which means it is allowed by the management. It tells your that the manager wants them to push food when it is a problem and hopes no one complains.

Went here last night for a date night out. Hostesses was nice, got a table right away. That was the highlight.... Waiter came over and took our orders. We ordered chips, guacamole and salsa for an appetizer... it took him over 30 min to bring the app to the table. Literally less than 10 min before the dinners arrived!  And thats only after we called him to the table with the tablet. Crazy! Needless to say, I will not be wanting Red Robin anytime soon, and I think I'll drive to Sherwood before going back to this one.  Not to mention, for the price you pay, you would think that you would get some meat with all the fried breading! It's a crazy amount of breading on the shrimp, fish, even chicken strips!  Too bad....

We eat here a lot because it's one of the few places you can eat with a gluten allergy. The problem is you never know what you are going to get. Sometimes the food is wonderful and hot and drinks are quickly refilled. Other times they give you 1 basket of fries for 8 people for the entire meal and cold food. If you want a guaranteed hot meal go somewhere else.

Come here somewhat regularly with a friend. Food is always good. But, after the 5th or 6th time of receiving terrible service - I feel I have to say something. It always takes forever to be greeted, get drinks, and get an order placed. A few of these visits have been while the restaurant literally has 3 other tables present and we still don't receive prompt service.  It just feels like this location doesn't care. The only reason they get 2 stars is because the food is good and the only employee that seems to care for the customer is Jillian - she is an absolute gem of a server.
Always a great place to eat, drink & be mary! Didn't meet mary, sure she's a nice lady.
I enjoy this location. They seem friendlier than others. Not quite as busy. I'm always happy with the Cold Drinks & Hot Fresh Food.

BEWARE!  Asked for a lemon with my water.    Only the water came.  Two tables got their drinks before I got the lemon.  Asked for cheeseburger slider and it came out with American cheese.   Sent it back and by the time I got the burger I decided I had enough with the service and got my burger to go.   Got home and the cooks scraped the American cheese from the sides and left the top and then topped it with cheddar.   AND THE MEAT WAS RAW. I am hoping my children's burgers were at least well done.

Gotta be worst Red Robin experience. I understand you are trying to stay open during remodel but seriously service here is awful.  While waiting almost a hour the one of three hosts are telling new arrivals "about a half hour hour wait" They have no clue what is going on and where is the manager? It's Friday night! Who is running this crap show?  Just sitting back and watching the chaos, trying not to get upset but this will be out last trip to this location and maybe Red Robin.  Want to add that the remodel is going the wrong direction, they got rid of kids games and arcades to put a messy chalk wall. Parents have kids just making a huge mess, once family's get this is not a kid friendly place they are going to loose a good portion of business. The decor is so mismatched it doesn't make a lot of sense. Uncomfortable seating too
Great burgers and professional staff. A real classy joint with great service. The burgers are a little spendy but they are the best in town. Plus you get a free burger on your birthday month!

One star because the food wasn't bad. But it took 90 minutes for 4 hamburgers, and then when they came, 50% of the order was wrong. The waitress was upbeat and pleasant, though not entirely accurate or attentive, but was nice enough to warrant a star for herself. When we asked for the manager to discuss the unacceptable performance from the kitchen, the manager was righteous, moderately indignant, and actually had the audacity to tell us we were mistaken about how long we had been waiting. Apparently, customer service training excludes management in the Red Robin Corporation.  Order taken at 7:30pm, hamburgers delivered at 9:00pm. 2 of the orders wrong. Aside from the inaccuracy, where I come from, that's 90 minutes. There was no apology, only a smug "Well, the kitchen was backed up."  There were only a few tables in the restaurant occupied! As we were leaving, they offered us a free slice of mud pie. We didn't accept because by then, all we wanted was to fly out of Red Robin. 2 burgers got sent back to the kitchen because they weren't remotely the correct order, and it was 15 minutes to get the right burger. In my humble opinion, they should have been free. All the respect in the world to mud pie we didn't want.  Listen, I can accept mistakes or the fact that Ernesto walked out on his job in the kitchen. A little communication would help, but a manager who refuses to own up to problems and make them right, and worse calls the customer a liar for bringing them to her attention, makes this Red Robin a place you don't want to nest.
Great burgers and service,  but,  spendy... Therefore beyond my price point except when my grandson demands one of these burger monsters... Lol

We needed place to eat after visiting Fry's (why is it in Wilsonville? whatever ...) and haven't eaten at RR for years. I had the chicken burger and my wife and our friend had an actual burger. The endless fries were good and plentiful. Sauces were great. Service was really good.

What a mistake.  Decided to give Red Robin another chance for my son's sake and once again the service is appalling. It appears that management has not instilled the training necessary for any of the employees.  There isn't a smile on any worker and they move as slow as a Port worker during a planned "slowdown".  I don't normally give a place a bad review unless it is a situation like this that is so shockingly opposite of expectations.  I don't know when I'll have to give them another chance for my child's sake, but I hope by that time changes will occur.

I will admit it, Red Robin is not usually my first choice of burger places since I live in Portland and there are so many places to get a grubbin' burger....but, my family  needed a mutual meeting place to do a little holiday celebrating and Red Robin in Wilsonville fit our needs.  I was actually highly impressed with the food. It seems Red Robin has stepped up their game a skosh. The menus were impressive and the presentation of the food was even better. The fries came in these little tin holders and the burgers were neatly wrapped and stayed that way. Our burgers were great, onion rings were on point and the endless steak fries were, well...endless.  My soda was continuously refilled, in fact, I never even noticed when it was refiled and back in front of me because I was too busy stuffing my face and visiting with my family.  My only complaint was that we were sat by the door and it was freezing! Every time someone came in or left, the breeze would hit us and we ended up having to keep our jackets on. This was not a negative thing, per say, just kind of an annoyance.  Overall, I would definitely go back. We were all full and pleased. :)

All in all decent service. The last couple of times my husband and I have went, they have either been short staffed or busy because we weren't checked on often. The staff is friendly and the food is good. Red Robin is decent but, I haven't loved it like I did when I went to the Red Robin in Salem.
Great service, clean, delicious food. Like that you can pay at kiosk on table.

Awful service (slow, server was rude), food was barely warm, took 40 minutes to get food, food below average and costs too much.  Do yourself a favor and go to Oswego Grill for a quality burger at the same price.  It will be served hot!
Awesome as usual the service is fast and the food is good as always. Red robin himself is their Tuesday and thursday from 6-8 pm. That is the highlight of our trip for my  4 year old daughter.

Yes, it's a chain and while I don't disdain chains, I would prefer to not go to them. However, that being said, Red Robin consistently offers awesome food that is fresh. The blackened Cajun Burger is awesome - not hot enough!!! Their bottomless fries are worth the trip. Never been a huge fan of McDonald's or Burger King; I'd rather pay a few more dollars to get my burgers at RR. Plus, they'll make your burger however way you want it - good for my dad who can only eat plain burgers. Their appetizers are good, too - especially the onion tower. I try to limit my fast food/eating out excursions, but I'll make a side trip here once every few months.

This is a tasty place for a chain restaurant.  The last time I was there I had an opportunity to eat on the patio and given the turn in the weather it might be the last time for a while. The caesar chicken wraps and fries were very tasty and they kept the soda refills coming. The service was prompt and efficient.  I like this location as there is plenty of parking right by the restaurant which is not the case at some of their locations around town.

Wait, what?  A 900 calorie Oreo milkshake?  Wait, what?  I ate it anyway???  YES.  The. Best. Milkshake. I. Have. Ever. Tasted.  It was an out of this world experience.   Normally I like to watch what I eat, but I have a soft spot for milkshakes so I had to try the "Rookie Magic".  They give you the glass, and also the tin that they make the shake in.  You begin drinking the milkshake and it's like some kind of angel has landed on your shoulder and said, "it's okay, you can finish this and run 10 miles tomorrow."  So you keep drinking.  Finally you get near the end, and you start EATING the milkshake because there are so many bits and pieces of Oreo mashed on the bottom.  It's pure heaven.

Came here for lunch with my boss. We were seated right away and it's red robin so you know what you were going to get. My biggest thing in service is making sure my drink is always full and they came through big time. Good service and decent, reasonably priced food. That's why you go to Red Robin and this location is no exception.

After ordering the Vegetarian burger I got a MICROWAVED grain patty just as tasteless and undercooked as I could have intentionally done myself. The manager had no problem letting me know they had microwaved it and that this was their only meatless option other than salad. The burger was garbage. I guess that's what I get for not wanting to eat animals. So, maybe that's the quality of food I deserve.

As someone else had mentioned, friends and I tend to use Red Robin as the barometer for burger joints.  I've been to many Red Robins, the service is always pretty solid, the burgers are always pretty good for the price and bottomless fries are always a nice touch.  I'm a big fan of the Milkshakes as well.  The new smoke and pepper burger is a great addition, and can compete with a lot of burgers in my opinion.  I like the addition of the new sauces, but don't like the idea of having to pay extra for them.

I had a order gone wrong a month ago and I came in today to redeem my order and the manager on duty took care of me! I was impressed with how he super serviced me to make things right. Definitely will be coming back to get my dine in burgers here. Also eating at the bar you have a server at all times when you need something.

Keep in mind as you read this that I love my burgers and Red Robin is NOT one of my favorite place for burgers due to the amount of calories that go into the burgers beyond what's in the meat(i.e buttering the bun).  So basically I usually end up at Red Robin because the kids like to go or because the options in Wilsonville are few. I end up at this Red Robin usually for work related reasons and usually end up with something other than a burger.  As a healthy low calorie option I get the natural burger with the garden burger patty and a lettuce wrap.  Ends up being under 300 calories I believe.  But since most of you are looking for burger reviews I will stop here. What I can say is the service here is always great, the staff is friendly, and a good option with few choices in Wilsonville.   Fun if you have kids.

I am a frequent here I have to say that my experience last night was terrible, to the point where it may have been my last visit. Took an hour from being seated to getting food. Waitress was unwelcoming, mixed up our orders, burgers came cold and fries soggy, mold on vegetables.... Really?? Oh, and you ran out of cups for water? Unheard of. To top it off, we got food poisoning (surprise). Suggestion: Blazers games would be a nice addition to your remodel...
Meh. Not my bag but good customer service and decent bar.

I'm kind of biased toward Red Robin, having grown up with it on "special occasions" (it was always my first choice for birthday dinner, age 6-16).  The bottomless fries, over-the-top burger creations and funky decor evoke a lifetime of good time memories (except for that one horrible date with my greasy loser boyfriend, who made me pay for Valentine's Dinner because he "forgot his wallet"... douche).   The Wilsonville location has been our local default for a couple years now, and I'm so glad we're next to such a great representation of the brand.  The waiters are always friendly and extremely accommodating.  They've made any substitution or special request we've made flawlessly, even suggesting fun customizations we'd never thought of.  Throw some honey mustard poppyseed dressing on that chicken sandwich!  It'll be delicious!  Campfire sauce with your fries?  Sure!  Here's some more yummy steak fries.  You didn't ask for them, but we just knew you wanted them.  On a recent trip I was asking quite a few questions about the menu, trying to figure out what might be the healthiest option.  She promptly grabbed me a nutrition fact menu without even needing a request.   The food is consistently good, and you can count on your favorites still being the way you love them time after time.  Service is almost always very fast, even when they're busy.  They keep the Diet Coke refills coming, which keeps me very happy.  The restaurant is always clean, and you can even see Red Robin on Thursdays!   Good, friendly service and great food.  It's a combination the Wilsonville Red Robin gets right.
Food took 40 minutes, waiter checked on our table once, brought the wrong order. With 2 kids and a family... Ridiculous. Normally 4 stars but tonight was horrible!

It's a national chain, so you know what to expect when you come here. The menu has a lot of variety and the our order was very good. We like the garlic-parmesan fries (no longer on the menu) but available for a small upcharge upon request. My hubby had a great burger, a generous patty, thick cheese and smoky bacon on nicely cooked on a tasty bun with fresh toppings. I had a grilled chicken sandwich with BBQ sauce, cheese & bacon. It was good, but I think they do burgers better than chicken, which didn't have the "grill" taste I would have preferred. Prices are on the high end, but service is fast & friendly and they are consistent.  I prefer the local dives for burgers, but Red Robin is a nice alternative!

Okay...yes...this is a review of a chain.  But I wanted to give a special mentioning for this one.  I've been here on multiple occasions and have YET to have had even one bad experience.   Also a friend & I got into the habit of getting their YUMMY Cobb Salad for lunch...so when we ordered it to go & mentioned we were spliltting it, they kindly divided it into two separate to go containers (which portion-wise equated to more than one normal cobb salad order). Very nice!  I really appreciated the extra effort!!! And who doesn't love the bottomless fries!!!  I mean really?

The star rating reflects the fact that this restaurant is good at what they're aiming for.  Just like you wouldn't wear a tuxedo to a rock concert (would you?), don't come here for fast food or fine dining. The service here was pretty darn good.  Before I could think refill, it was already there.  Before I could wonder about what else I might want to add to the order, our waiter had already offered.  They use food runners here, which I hate.  It always turns into an auction at the table.  Overall, the service boosted the effort put forth by the kitchen. The food was what's expected at a Red Robin.  Yum!...for the most part.  The bottomless steak fries were crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, providing a delicious combination perfect for fries.  We also had the chips and salsa appetizer, which comes with a tasty guacamole.  The salsa isn't anything special, but the guacamole makes them worth ordering again.  I had a burger, ordered medium, but cooked well, which made the burger dry.  The crispy jalapenos were no longer crispy, and obviously had not just come out of the fryer.  The product sent out by the kitchen was sub-par and diminished my previous evaluation of this chain.
Katie is always a great bartender! I enjoy sitting at the bar. One you can always get seated quickly two you get to know the bartender and three they have nice TVS to watch the game on!

Food was fine as expected, but the staff were so noisy. Seriously are they deaf or just obnoxious? And even if you are a family restaurant you could still have a policy of first seating folks with children in a particular area. I'm fine with kids but I don't want to always be around them when dining.
The service was awesome and the food was wonderful as usual.  The stake fries are the best!!  They could update the inside by adding new flat screen monitors and more of them.
Not a great location for service and cleanliness. We would drive to the Sherwood location and wait in line over going to the Wilsonville one that was a mile from our house.

After walking in, me and my boyfriend were greeted by two hostess. They seem college aged and not very friendly. They had no smiles on your face. After putting the menu on the table, the words from the hostess was, your server will be right with you. Right now red robin is serving the red tavern burger for 6.99. For that price, it comes with unlimited steak fries. The burger itself is a double patty burger with tomato, lettuce, cheese and onion. For $1, you can upgrade it to the different types of burger that is listed, such as a jalepeno burger, buffalo burger or even a ghost pepper burger!!!   Our server was very polite and nice. However she had a hearing aide, so the way she spoke was kind of strange. Seeing someone with a 'disability' hired at red robin, I think that was nice. The food came in  a timely manner. She did check up on us, which was nice. -Just a thought- -The bar area is really small here, I wouldnt think this would be an ideal happy hour -place. - This location is kind of new, but some of the flat screens were kind of fuzzy. - This place has an arcade corner, that needs to be bigger. That corner looks very cramp.

THE DATE 16 December 2008, i.e., Birthday No. 24 THE TIME Around noon. Maybe noon-fifteen THE SCENE Normally for birthdays in the office, our Supplies Manager and Customer Service Guru J makes sure that everyone (i.e., the other four employees) is signed up to bring some sort of delectable treat for a potluck lunch, because in these economically stressed times, we're not going to buy lunch for the office that often. This morning, J comes in sans crock pot full of enchilada soupy goodness, saying her hubby forgot to stick it in the fridge before going to sleep, and he wouldn't let her take it to work, fearful that we'd all get food poisoning. Then coworker N comes in, sans raspberry-filled chocolate cupcake deliciousness, citing weather for preventing him from picking them up from his ma's. Then boss B comes in, wielding a box...of magical birthday donuts. We obviously take said donuts and love them until there were no more, but this was also at 8 a.m., and by the time lunch rolled around, we all found ourselves hungry and without food. Dilemma! J, an adamant supporter of Sonic, suggested we go there. This was just as adamantly shot down by a chorus of staff who did not want to sit in B's car without heat in the ice, eating tots. Thai? N would have none of it. Mexi? Had that yesterday. As we were about to settle for shivering with our greasy goodness, B shouts out "RED ROBIN." And it doesn't sound half bad, but in the back of my head, I'm thinking, "Shiiiit, this is one of those places that will sing to you...YEEP!" I make them promise no funny business, and they don't say a word. THE WEATHER Second day of ARCTIC BLAST 2008...ice and snow and salted ground. ACT II We're all seated at a booth (why couldn't we get that huge round-table booth??), and are very quickly asked if we were ready to order. Uhhh...no...but thanks! We all ordered. We all enjoyed a basket of burgers and fries that was WAY too big for lunch. But we pretty much all ate it all. The guacamole bacon burger was pretty good, although it could have used a little spice. But basically anything involving bacon and/or avocados has my endorsement. B pulled out all the guns with the Burning Love burger...they packed as much heat as humanly possible on this thing--a jalapeno-infused kaiser bun, cayenne-seasoned beef patty, chipotle mayo, pepper jack cheese, salsa, and fried jalapenos--and he commented that it could have been hotter. I'm not sure if I believe him. Because, you know, it might be a little awkward if I asked him for a bite. CLIMAX We get our check, and B graciously takes it like a man (or like our boss). Our server also leaves a survey so he could give them feedback on the burger (apparently they're the only location in Oregon serving the Burning Love, for some reason). He starts filling it out. Then I see him flip over the survey and write something on it, making sure his hand is covering the words. Then he slips it into the bill-fold thinger, and the waitress takes it. B is pretty bad at keeping secrets, at least when he's trying to play a prank on someone. And I glance at him because I know something's up, and he's got a totally goofy smirk on his face. Oh, crap, I tell myself. When's the singing gonna come? Then, I hear it: Who's the birthday girl?? One of the servers ask. Of course it was me. What's your name, hun? Danielle. Okay, now take this spoon, and hold it up high, she continues as she plops down a hot fudge sundae in front of me. Then they do their clappy sing-sing thing and go away... DENOUEMENT ...but not before I ask for three more spoons. B, very satisfied with himself, exclaims that he HAD to bring me here because he HAD to get a rise out of me. Hahahahaha! And we all enjoyed some ice cream before going home to work. THE MORAL Red Robin isn't a bad place. It actually has pretty decent food. And the wait staff was sweet as sugar (especially the lady who called me princess and asked where I got my hat). So yeah, I dig it...even if 10 year olds--and obnoxious bosses--get the most entertainment value. :)
